programme.title: Motherless Brooklyn
Osierocony Brooklyn
programme.desc:
Motherless Brooklyn: Directed by Edward Norton. With Edward Norton, Gugu Mbatha-Raw, Alec Baldwin, Willem Dafoe. In 1950s New York, a lonely private detective afflicted with Tourette's Syndrome ventures to solve the murder of his mentor and only friend." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0385887/","name":"Motherless Brooklyn","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzQ0Mjk1YjItNWI1Ny00NWE2LWFlYTAtYjViY2YzMTVlOGVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001570/","name":"Edward Norton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1813221/","name":"Gugu Mbatha-Raw"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000285/","name":"Alec Baldwin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001570/","name":"Edward Norton"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0456097/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113781/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113140/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001570/","name":"Edward Norton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0504672/","name":"Jonathan Lethem"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi800112409","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWQ2YjJlYWItNjQxMi00ZWNjLTgxNjAtMzc4NTRmZjI3NTAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWQ2YjJlYWItNjQxMi00ZWNjLTgxNjAtMzc4NTRmZjI3NTAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Set against the backdrop of 1950s New York, 'Motherless Brooklyn' follows Lionel Essrog (Edward Norton), a private detective living with Tourette Syndrome, as he ventures to solve the murder of his mentor and only friend, Frank Minna (Bruce Willis). Armed only with a few clues and the engine of his obsessive mind, Lionel unravels closely-guarded secrets that hold the fate of the whole city in the balance. In a mystery that carries him from gin-soaked jazz clubs in Harlem to the hard-edged slums of Brooklyn and, finally, into the gilded halls of New York's power brokers, Lionel contends with thugs, corruption and the most dangerous man in the city to honor his friend and save the woman who might be his own salvation."},"datePublished":"2019-11-01","description":"In 1950s New York, a lonely private detective afflicted with Tourette's Syndrome ventures to solve the murder of his mentor and only friend.","keywords":"neo noir,1950s,jazz music,based on novel,detective","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0385887/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"graham-b-kent"},"dateCreated":"2019-11-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Tourette is Finally Depicted Responsibly","reviewBody":"The first time I saw Tourette Syndrome portrayed in mainstream film was, as I imagine is the same for many others, in Deuce Bigalow. It wouldn't be the last time, however, that the portrayal was an exaggeration of coprolalia (the swearing tic), the shock value of which was used for a cheap and easy laugh.

Over the years, I've seen that many people have presumptions about this neurological disorder - understandable, given the circumstances. Unfortunately, I've also learned the hard way that many of these presumptions have been heavily (and negatively) biased towards this inferred 'swearing tic', and I can't help but feel like Deuce Bigalow, or Not Another Teen Movie, or others, have helped shape this presumption.

The presumption honestly doesn't bother me, provided the person holding the belief is willing to have a conversation with me about it. I've always been open about my Tourette, and I consider myself lucky and fortunate to have won awards, or spoken with the media, or inspired others, due to my openness and having some small success with writing and acting.

What does get to me, though, is when the people aren't willing to have a conversation with me. I've been fired from jobs once it's become known that I have Tourette, even though it hasn't affected my work. I've had dates suddenly lose interest. I've been kicked out of bars when bouncers have mistaken my tics for drug use and refused to hear any explanation without threatening violence.

So when I heard that Edward Norton would be portraying someone with Tourette Syndrome in #MotherlessBrooklyn, I was excited to see what an actor of such calibre would do with such a complex condition. And I was not disappointed.

Motherless Brooklyn is great. Adapted from the novel and written and directed for the screen by Edward himself, the film is an enthralling and charming noir detective piece peppered with big names playing relatively small roles, all of whom tell a captivating story about government corruption in 1950s New York.

Edward's presentation of Tourette Syndrome was refreshing. It was delivered with a level of maturity and respect that is seldom seen on the silver screen. And even though the condition is never outright named in the film, much like his tics, it can't be hidden from anyone watching.

And yes, his character does have coprolalia, and echolalia (the tic where you have to repeat things said), and other verbal and motor tics. And sometimes it's funny. But his tics aren't just a cheap laugh for the audience - they affect his character. A PI trying to stay unnoticed on the subway who suddenly blurts out some choice words and draws attention to himself is funny. And when he's consoling someone and can't stop touching their shoulder, it's funny. And when they reassure him that it's okay, it's endearing.

And it's okay for us to laugh at the realities of life, however absurd or uncontrollable they may be at times. Tourette Syndrome is real and sometimes it's funny and that's okay. But at least in this film, we're finally laughing at it for the right reasons. And with his portrayal, which also shows some of the positives that can come with Tourette - as opposed to just the obviously stare-inducing drawbacks - I am hopeful that this may help provide the less-aware with a better, more informed presumption about this condition.

Are there actors out there with Tourette Syndrome (and who are open about it) that could have played this role? Absolutely. Like me. But I'm not Edward Norton. And are there actors out there with Tourette Syndrome (and closeted about it) that could have played this role? Absolutely. But they are also not Edward Norton.

The issue of roles going to actors who don't live with the condition being portrayed has been a hot-button issue for many, and I do think there are instances where the role should have gone to someone else. This isn't one of those times. Actors are actors, after all - their job is to convince you that they're not pretending.

Edward was convincing. And I - and I imagine a number of others with Tourette Syndrome who have been subject to unfair or illegal treatment due, at least in part, to a sub-par late '90s movie - thank him for being so. I was fortunate enough to see this at TIFF this year, where he introduced the film. Had he stayed for a Q&A afterwards, I would have loved to have said this to him in person. But I doubt I am the first, and know I won't be the last, person to say this.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":47271,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"duration":"PT2H24M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
The Man from U.N.C.L.E.: Directed by Guy Ritchie. With Henry Cavill, Armie Hammer, Alicia Vikander, Elizabeth Debicki. In the early 1960s, CIA agent Napoleon Solo and KGB operative Illya Kuryakin participate in a joint mission against a mysterious criminal organization, which is working to proliferate nuclear weapons." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1638355/","name":"The Man from U.N.C.L.E.","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTZmMWFhYmQtZDE5YS00YzBlLWJlOGEtYzAwNGU1YzVlYjZlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzkwMjQ5NzM@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0147147/","name":"Henry Cavill"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2309517/","name":"Armie Hammer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2539953/","name":"Alicia Vikander"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005363/","name":"Guy Ritchie"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0449458/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0204562/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005363/","name":"Guy Ritchie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0927880/","name":"Lionel Wigram"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0458566/","name":"Jeff Kleeman"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Man From U.N.C.L.E. Comic-Con Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2578821913","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1MzU3MzczN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODc4MzMyNjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1MzU3MzczN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODc4MzMyNjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the early 1960s, CIA agent Napoleon Solo and KGB operative Illya Kuryakin participate in a joint mission against a mysterious criminal organization, which is working to proliferate nuclear weapons."},"datePublished":"2015-08-26","description":"In the early 1960s, CIA agent Napoleon Solo and KGB operative Illya Kuryakin participate in a joint mission against a mysterious criminal organization, which is working to proliferate nuclear weapons.","keywords":"cia agent,spy,kgb agent,cold war,kgb","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1638355/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"charafernando"},"dateCreated":"2017-04-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Underrated, extremely fun, and cool movie","reviewBody":"From the soundtrack, to the settings, costumes, characters, and action, the man from UNCLE is an exciting and classy action movie. It takes the bond formula and recreates it through Guy Richie's unmistakable lens.

I honestly think Napoleon Solo (one of the main characters, an American Spy) was a perfect role for Henry Cavill, who knocked it out of the park... an Archer-esque, suave, witty charmer/womanizer. The same can be said of Armie Hammer and Alicia Vikander's characters

This is a witty, lighthearted, and funny movie and seriously underrated. It is definitely a go-to relax and enjoy movie for me","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":283599,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
Twelve: Directed by Angel Manuel Soto. With Jahi Di'Allo Winston, Meek Mill, William Catlett, Donielle T. Hansley Jr.. Fourteen-year-old Mouse desperately wants to join the Midnight Clique, an infamous group of Baltimore dirt-bike riders who rule the summertime streets." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9048840/","name":"Twelve","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmFlOGQ2MjgtOTkzOC00ODg2LTkxNWUtYTNkOTJjNjVmMjRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDM2NDM2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8091769/","name":"Jahi Di'Allo Winston"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4049674/","name":"Meek Mill"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2825058/","name":"William Catlett"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3924049/","name":"Angel Manuel Soto"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0072775/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026545/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1954466/","name":"Sherman Payne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4777327/","name":"Christopher M. Boyd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1941103/","name":"Kirk Sullivan"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2394734873","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWRjOTI2ZWItYWVmOC00ZjQxLTk0NTEtYmQwZjA0YWY5N2U4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWRjOTI2ZWItYWVmOC00ZjQxLTk0NTEtYmQwZjA0YWY5N2U4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","description":"In this gritty coming-of-age drama, fourteen-year-old Mouse (Jahi Di'Allo Winston) desperately wants to join the Midnight Clique, an infamous group of Baltimore dirt-bike riders who rule the summertime streets. His older brother, Stro, was their top rider before his tragic death--a loss that consumes Mouse as much as his passion for bikes. Mouse's mom (Teyonah Parris) and his police mentor, Detective Rivers (William Catlett), work overtime to help the charismatic teen reach his full potential, but when the Midnight Clique's leader, Blax (Meek Mill), takes the boy under his wing, the lure of revving his own dirt bike skids Mouse toward a road way past the straight and narrow.
Streaming October 8th only on HBOMax."},"datePublished":"2020-10-08","description":"Fourteen-year-old Mouse desperately wants to join the Midnight Clique, an infamous group of Baltimore dirt-bike riders who rule the summertime streets.","keywords":"14 year old,14 year old boy,dirt bike,group,number as title","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9048840/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"xNecRosex"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not enough","reviewBody":"There is very little one can find enjoyable in this film. It misses the mark in most cases, it's passable but very cliché ridden screenplay. Utterly stupid choices made by the characters throughout the movie just underscore the flaws in the screenplay. Cinematography etc is decent but it's just very empty and totally forgettable.

No need to watch this really.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1785,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"duration":"PT2H5M"}</script><metacontent="

succession of images is not a film","reviewBody":"First, the title is wrong: the king is absent of the movie and carricatured when shown. The link between the king and the people is not shown or analysed.

Second, even if the episodes or the short stories are well depicted and in a way interesting, it doesn't make a film. Where is a story? Where is something to care about? It's not even a documentary. It's not much...

Third, the « left wing » (populist?) vision of a people betrayed by the « elites » is boring.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1184,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"duration":"PT2H1M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 0253754, Title: Star Trek: Nemesis, --- Description: Star Trek: Nemesis: Directed by Stuart Baird. With Patrick Stewart, Jonathan Frakes, Brent Spiner, LeVar Burton. The Enterprise is diverted to the Romulan homeworld Romulus, supposedly because they want to negotiate a peace treaty. Captain Picard and his crew discover a serious threat to the Federation once Praetor Shinzon plans to attack Earth." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0253754/","name":"Star Trek: Nemesis","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAxNjY2NDY3NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjA0MTEzMw@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001772/","name":"Patrick Stewart","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000408/","name":"Jonathan Frakes","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000653/","name":"Brent Spiner"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000829/","name":"Stuart Baird"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0437457/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0734472/","name":"Gene Roddenberry","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0517589/","name":"John Logan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0075834/","name":"Rick Berman"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Star Trek: Nemesis","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3498705177","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTEzYzU0NjktNWM1Yy00Y2EwLWJmZDQtZTI4MzgzNDFjNzE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTEzYzU0NjktNWM1Yy00Y2EwLWJmZDQtZTI4MzgzNDFjNzE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Paramount Home Entertainment","datePublished":"2002-12-13","description":"The Enterprise is diverted to the Romulan homeworld Romulus, supposedly because they want to negotiate a peace treaty. Captain Picard and his crew discover a serious threat to the Federation once Praetor Shinzon plans to attack Earth","keywords":"starship versus starship,based on cult favorite,fictional war,universe,velocity","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0253754/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"webmaster-88","dateCreated":"2003-08-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Well, at least the music isn't bad","reviewBody":"It has always been easy to level criticism at Star Trek films, for either being too slow, to action-packed, too Trekkie, not Trekkie enough, or whatever. The fact of the matter is, is that none of them are classics, except for the people who know and love the characters in them: namely, Trekkies.

It has been said that Stuart Baird was brought on board to try and open up Trek to a wider audience, but that simply insults the viewers Trek already has. Voyager tried, and failed, and Enterprise is rapidly going the same route.

The better Trek films are those that revolve around the character-dynamics, and seeing those people work as a team. In those films, such as Wrath of Khan, The Undiscovered Country, or First Contact, the comradeship of the protagonists is evident.

Not so in Nemesis, which is ironic, especially considering the entire film is purportedly about such relationships. None of the characters have been drastically altered, as many might suggest, but there is very little interaction between them, there's no moment where the viewer would think "only Picard/Data/whoever" would get them out of this situation. It's all a bit [for lack of a better word] bleh. There's no adventure, something that has been missing from Trek since First Contact.

Shinzon is a powerful character, a wonderful character, but sorely underused. It's almost as if he's never really serious about what he's doing, and as such, never seems to pose much of a threat. This is emphasized through the cliched dramatic countdown timer sequence (used excessively in Trek, but here lacks substance, especially since it is entirely and utterly pointless).

Nemesis starts off well, full of hope and joy, and the prospect of Troi and Riker's wedding, and the viewer too, is led into a false sense of hope at the prospect of the film. But Stuart Baird lets us down harshly. He was the wrong director for the job: the script (if you listen to the dialogue, watch the cut scenes, etc) is not an action script, but a character-driven one, with a few action elements.

Baird has turned that on its head, and produced an action film, with very little character involvement.

As a plus point, it must be noted that Goldsmith has outdone himself - the music (although in parts evidently synthesized rather than orchestrated) is a delight. Buy the CD, and forget the film.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":75181,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"duration":"PT1H56M"</script><metacontent="

Gigantic monsters threaten to destroy everything in their path as mankind remains defenseless." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10238788/","name":"Monster Island","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWJhMDA4YWYtNmY4Ni00ZjMwLTllNzQtNjM2ZDlmOWYyODBkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc2ODExOTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Gigantic monsters threaten to destroy everything in their path as mankind remains defenseless.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10238788/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"refbumrulz"},"dateCreated":"2019-06-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"LOL, D list actors at their worst","reviewBody":"Eric Roberts. WHY hire him? WHY WHY? He wasn't wearing the correct uniform and needed a haircut BADLY for being in the "navy".

The submarine existed of about $100 worth of materials. It looked like those zero turn mower handles were on it. The hatch was thinner than an aluminum garbage can lid. They did put 4 over size pressure gauges in the sub to make it look technical haha. This movie is NOT to be taken seriously. When the sub comes out of the ocean you can see another object underneath it lifting it up above water. There were no "monsters" in this movie at all. Just very poor cgi 3 second glimpes of a limb or something.

I've seen better High School movie productions from up and coming film makers. Yes, is is that bad. Only watch if you want to shake your head from side to side at the utter amazement that someone even financed this movie.

If I was in it, I would not put this on my resume. I'd swear I must have had someone look like me and steal my name. Yes, once a gain. It is that bad.

Evidently, so far the ratings of 1 seem to actually be telling the truth. One very positive reviewer must be one of the stars relatives.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":575,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":2.7},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2019-06-01","keywords":"sea monster,helicopter,submarine,psychotronic film,underwater scene","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3779051289","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDE2MGVhZTktZGEwYy00NWEyLTg4MjgtYThkMDk2NzQ0N2Q5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDE2MGVhZTktZGEwYy00NWEyLTg4MjgtYThkMDk2NzQ0N2Q5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000616/","name":"Eric Roberts"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0865084/","name":"Toshi Toda"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1345685/","name":"Adrian Bouchet"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0040630/","name":"Mark Atkins"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042909/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0040630/","name":"Mark Atkins"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Drag Me to Hell
Wrota do piekieł
programme.desc: Drag Me to Hell: Directed by Sam Raimi. With Alison Lohman, Justin Long, Lorna Raver, Dileep Rao. A loan officer who evicts an old woman from her home finds herself the recipient of a supernatural curse. Desperate, she turns to a seer to try and save her soul, while evil forces work to push her to a breaking point." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1127180/","name":"Drag Me to Hell","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQwNTMyNjc5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTI2MTQ0Mg@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Horror"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0517844/","name":"Alison Lohman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0519043/","name":"Justin Long"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0515207/","name":"Ruth Livier"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000600/","name":"Sam Raimi"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0116611/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0176807/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000600/","name":"Sam Raimi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0706898/","name":"Ivan Raimi"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Drag Me to Hell: Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3899917081","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ3NjE3NzE3M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTcwNDEzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ3NjE3NzE3M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTcwNDEzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A loan officer (Lohman) ordered to evict an old woman from her home finds herself the recipient of a supernatural curse which turns her life into a living nightmare."},"datePublished":"2009-10-07","description":"A loan officer who evicts an old woman from her home finds herself the recipient of a supernatural curse. Desperate, she turns to a seer to try and save her soul, while evil forces work to push her to a breaking point.","keywords":"psychic,evil,fight,psychologist,hell","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1127180/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"hey_treacle"},"dateCreated":"2009-05-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Sam Raimi has made his 'Jaws'.","reviewBody":"Drag me to Hell is, really, a throwback in so many ways to the fun of The Evil Dead 2. The camera angles, the excellent score - it all recalls how Raimi played with us in his earlier trilogy. What has changed however, is the sense of pace. We know its coming and Raimi employs all his skills to draw out the tension. The thrills are all there in place, I jumped like there was an electric buzzer under my seat. Perhaps a little too much CGI is indulged in but its easy to forgive in a film as wicked and blackly comic as this. I genuinely found the film disturbing for a 15 as well, again I think this is a mark of tension that Raimi creates with the score and camera work throughout the film. So incredibly refreshing to see a horror film with out the hallmarks of the recent saw franchise. Special mention for the ending, which has conviction and guts and was the proverbial cherry on top of the cake. throughly entertaining.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":191188,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Cykl prezentujący wyselekcjonowany zbiór najlepszych filmów krótkometrażowych. Wiele z nich nagrodzonych zostało prestiżowymi wyróżnieniami na międzynarodowych galach i festiwalach filmowych. Każde pasmo przedstawia kilka produkcji na dany temat.

programme.title: Tata
programme.desc: Członkowie dwupokoleniowej rodziny próbują żyć ze świadomością o jej rozpadzie. Niektórzy starają się to akceptować i trwać w takiej rzeczywistości, a inni chcą się z niej wydostać. Liczne problemy, rozpadające się związki i rozwody negatywnie wpływają na stosunki międzyludzkie. Wszystko to odbija się na dzieciach, które w ten sposób tracą szansę na normalny rozwój. Przedstawiana historia widziana jest z perspektywy małego dziecka, obserwującego zachowania swoich rodziców. Rozgrywający się dramat ojca Janusza (Grzegorz Juchiewicz) uwidacznia bezsilność w bezwiednie zapoczątkowanej autodestrukcji.

programme.title: Niepospolita
programme.desc: Rok 1939. Pisarz Tadeusz Dołęga-Mostowicz (Patryk Szwichtenberg) podróżuje po Polsce ze swoją asystentką Dianą (Agata Różycka). Przeprowadza wywiady z ludźmi, którzy osiągnęli sukces w różnych dziedzinach. Na swojej drodze spotyka m.in. Melchiora Wańkowicza (Marek Karpowicz), Janusza Kusocińskiego, Eugeniusza Kwiatkowskiego i Hankę Ordonównę.

programme.title: Sole
Sole
programme.desc: Sole: Directed by Carlo Sironi. With Claudio Segaluscio, Sandra Drzymalska, Bruno Buzzi, Marco Felli. Lena is seven months pregnant and she's ready to sell the baby in her belly. Ermanno agrees to pretend to be the father. Fabio, the uncle of Ermanno, will pay them to buy the child that he and his wife Bianca cannot have. A fake adoption between relatives, a loophole to bypass the law cause in Italy the surrogate motherhood is forbidden. A world in which money is the only standard of value, the only thing that matter. Ermanno and Lena are two strangers that must pretend in public to be a couple and live together until the delivery. They are used to only think about themselves and they fight all the time. But living side by side they start becoming what they were only pretending to be." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9648994/","name":"Sole","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWYwMjI2YjUtMzAyOS00YWViLWJiY2UtYzcwZTliYjk5YTRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzMxMDgxNjc@._V1_.jpg","genre":["Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10421676/","name":"Claudio Segaluscio"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8272878/","name":"Sandra Drzymalska"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0125644/","name":"Bruno Buzzi"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0802910/","name":"Carlo Sironi"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0398661/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0349562/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0185099/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2664958/","name":"Antonio Manca"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3752255/","name":"Giulia Moriggi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0802910/","name":"Carlo Sironi"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2633482009","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWYzYjlkN2UtODFlNy00Yjg3LTgyYzItYjlhMTMzMTY5YzQwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWYzYjlkN2UtODFlNy00Yjg3LTgyYzItYjlhMTMzMTY5YzQwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"datePublished":"2019-10-24","description":"Lena is seven months pregnant and she's ready to sell the baby in her belly. Salam, an inexperienced young Palestinian man, becomes a writer on a popular soap opera after a chance meeting with an Israeli soldier. His creative career is on the rise - until the soldier and the show's financial backers disagree about how the show should end, and Salam is caught in the middle." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5791098/","name":"Tel Aviv on Fire","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDdmZGZkMzctODUxYy00MDllLTk0YWItZjI2M2UyY2IzZjA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjUzMTYzMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Salam, an inexperienced young Palestinian man, becomes a writer on a popular soap opera after a chance meeting with an Israeli soldier. programme.title: Coco avant Chanel
Coco Chanel
programme.desc:
Coco avant Chanel: Directed by Anne Fontaine. With Audrey Tautou, Benoît Poelvoorde, Alessandro Nivola, Marie Gillain. The story of Coco Chanel's rise from obscure beginnings to the heights of the fashion world." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1035736/","name":"Coco avant Chanel","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA0NjYzMzQxNzBeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU3MDI2MDA0ODI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of Coco Chanel's rise from obscure beginnings to the heights of the fashion world.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1035736/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ahifi"},"dateCreated":"2009-07-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Does what it says...","reviewBody":"Coco avant Chanel focuses, quite literally, on the roots of Coco before the whole Chanel business.

I noted the movie seemed to frustrate those with no grasp of the French language at all. Many seemed to go in unaware that the movie was set before her 'Chanel' days and I couldn't help but feel a sense of disappointment at the end from others; via looking at their faces, overhearing conversations and talking with friends. It's interesting, but it does plod on very slowly.

We are treated to a very rude, harsh character in Coco. Full credit goes to Audrey Tautou for her performance though. She really does fit into this movie's feel and tone very well. Her cheeky performance is definitely a highlight.

I don't know what to make of Alessandro Nivola as 'Boy'. The character was and looked rather sleazy. I'm not sure if that was meant or if that was Alessandro. Other than that, mentions go to Benoît Poelvoorde for his solid performance and Emmanuelle Devos as the sexy and self-assured Emilienne d'Alençon.

Other than that, it's a solid biopic. 7/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":39540,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2009-04-22","keywords":"life of celebrity before becoming famous,social status,1920s,beach,wealth","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2992290329","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTY0ODg1MTUtODNmNC00ZDUzLWI3YzEtNWU1OGM2ODNiZmQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTY0ODg1MTUtODNmNC00ZDUzLWI3YzEtNWU1OGM2ODNiZmQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0851582/","name":"Audrey Tautou"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0688143/","name":"Benoît Poelvoorde"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005273/","name":"Alessandro Nivola"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0284774/","name":"Anne Fontaine"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030799/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0254563/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1212643/","name":"Edmonde Charles-Roux"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0284774/","name":"Anne Fontaine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1597664/","name":"Camille Fontaine"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

crime","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2177827/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"smeurer-37893"},"dateCreated":"2015-03-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Haznavicious comes to terms with history","reviewBody":"I totally disagree with "madamebaterflaj" - although this isn't the "best film ever" (and how could it be, depicting the horror of war), it is not bad at all. Yes, it is anti-Russian, but don't you remember how the story went? It's like saying "Schindler's List is black-and-white anti-German propaganda".... It is an European point of view, of course, so even if there is a sort of happy end, the focus of the story are not the emotions of the characters, not even the characters maybe, but History and how we all are involved. The boy actor is simply terrific, some times he looks like an old guy, a grown up man, and then again he shows he's just a little boy. Beautiful photography. Beautiful soundtrack. Might be a bit too long but not that much.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2565,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"duration":"PT2H15M"}</script><metacontent="

crime","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2177827/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"smeurer-37893","dateCreated":"2015-03-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Haznavicious comes to terms with history","reviewBody":"I totally disagree with "madamebaterflaj" - although this isn't the "best film ever" (and how could it be, depicting the horror of war), it is not bad at all. Yes, it is anti-Russian, but don't you remember how the story went? It's like saying "Schindler's List is black-and-white anti-German propaganda".... It is an European point of view, of course, so even if there is a sort of happy end, the focus of the story are not the emotions of the characters, not even the characters maybe, but History and how we all are involved. The boy actor is simply terrific, some times he looks like an old guy, a grown up man, and then again he shows he's just a little boy. Beautiful photography. Beautiful soundtrack. Might be a bit too long but not that much.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2565,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"duration":"PT2H15M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Girl
Girl
programme.desc: Girl: Directed by Lukas Dhont. With Victor Polster, Arieh Worthalter, Oliver Bodart, Tijmen Govaerts. A promising teenage dancer enrolls at a prestigious ballet school while grappling with her gender dysphoria." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8254556/","name":"Girl","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYwMjMyODUtNDdhMi00NzRjLWEzNTktMDQyMDhlMDU2MDI2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A promising teenage dancer enrolls at a prestigious ballet school while grappling with her gender dysphoria.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8254556/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"roblesar99"},"dateCreated":"2018-09-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"An Emotionally Devastating Coming-of-Age Tale","reviewBody":"Emotionally devastating yet reassuringly empathetic, director Lukas Dhont's GIRL tells the story of transgender ballerina Lara as she seeks to complete her transition while struggling to achieve her dreams. Make no mistake, this is a tough film to watch (as exemplified by the cringing noises and gasps from the elderly women sitting in the row behind me), but it's also a rewarding one. Victor Polster delivers some of the best work of the year in his portrayal of the protagonist, and while some will rightly be bothered by the fact that Polster is a cisgender male actor who cannot ever known firsthand the difficulties that someone like Lara would have gone through her entire life, he nonetheless delivers an arresting, sensitive performance that adroitly examines these devastating struggles. And while the film does focus a fair amount on the struggles that Lara faces through her transition, it also highlights her resilience and courage, which define her more than anything else. I also have to point out that it's been a landmark year for movie dads, with Arieh Worthalter fitting right in with Michael Stuhlbarg's dad from CALL ME BY YOUR NAME, Josh Hamilton's dad from EIGHTH GRADE, and Tracy Letts' dad from LADY BIRD. Worthalter shines as a devoting father who desires nothing more than his daughter's happiness.\n\nIf there's one thing I disliked about GIRL, however, it's the slow pacing, which I really started to feel during the last fifteen minutes of the film or so. It's only 105 minutes long but each and every minute is certainly felt. I also wasn't the biggest fan of Dhont cutting the music off during certain scenes (let the scene play out, Dhont!). Despite my complaints and the fact that I might not have loved GIRL, I still certainly believe it's worth watching.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13297,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-10-17","keywords":"gender identity,gender reassignment,gender transition,ballet,transgender woman","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9760132/","name":"Victor Polster"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3581007/","name":"Arieh Worthalter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9854120/","name":"Oliver Bodart"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4080113/","name":"Lukas Dhont"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0115530/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0262573/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0364126/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4080113/","name":"Lukas Dhont"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3899543/","name":"Angelo Tijssens"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

Make no mistake, this is a tough film to watch (as exemplified by the cringing noises and gasps from the elderly women sitting in the row behind me), but it's also a rewarding one. Victor Polster delivers some of the best work of the year in his portrayal of the protagonist, and while some will rightly be bothered by the fact that Polster is a cisgender male actor who cannot ever known firsthand the difficulties that someone like Lara would have gone through her entire life, he nonetheless delivers an arresting, sensitive performance that adroitly examines these devastating struggles. And while the film does focus a fair amount on the struggles that Lara faces through her transition, it also highlights her resilience and courage, which define her more than anything else. I also have to point out that it's been a landmark year for movie dads, with Arieh Worthalter fitting right in with Michael Stuhlbarg's dad from CALL ME BY YOUR NAME, Josh Hamilton's dad from EIGHTH GRADE, and Tracy Letts' dad from LADY BIRD. Worthalter shines as a devoting father who desires nothing more than his daughter's happiness.\n\nIf there's one thing I disliked about GIRL, however, it's the slow pacing, which I really started to feel during the last fifteen minutes of the film or so. Generation Achievement meets impossible love.","keywords":"eastern europe,boy,one word title,teenage boy,teenage girl","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8360266/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"nairtejas"},"dateCreated":"2020-03-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"12th BIFFES Review: Psychobitch / Palpable High School Romance / 6 Stars","reviewBody":"Psychobitch is one of those high school romance stories that aspires to be socially relevant by exploring mental illness and manages to do that to some extent. However, the forced wickedness that one finds in the characters of Frida and Marius make the drama look like it was concocted just to make that point. But, it is still fun to watch as these characters fool around together in a brutal high school setting where making fun of each other and gossiping is the average order. There are a few palpable sequences (some funny, some serious) that you will take away from Psychobitch but anything more than that will be a stretch. programme.title: The Birdcatcher
W pułapce myśliwego
programme.desc: The Birdcatcher: Directed by Ross Clarke. With Sarah-Sofie Boussnina, Arthur Hakalahti, Jakob Cedergren, Laura Birn. A Jewish girl Esther is forced to conceal her identity as a boy on a Nazi-Norwegian farm. Plotting her escape to Sweden, her daily challenge to keep her true identity a secret, leads to a series of choices and consequences." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3160336/","name":"The Birdcatcher","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmE5MWUyODQtMjMyNy00MWVjLTgzMTEtZTU5YzNhYTliMmM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjg1NTU5MTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Jewish girl Esther is forced to conceal her identity as a boy on a Nazi-Norwegian farm. Plotting her escape to Sweden, her daily challenge to keep her true identity a secret, leads to a series of choices and consequences.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3160336/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CinemaSerf"},"dateCreated":"2020-04-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Yentl with snow instead of singing...","reviewBody":"An enjoyable, if fairly routine story of a young Jewish girl who manages to escape the clutches of her Nazi captors during WWII. She cuts her hair and dresses/acts as a boy and seeks refuge working on a remote farm. What's new? The difference is, this one is set in the harsher climate of Norway and her predicament is incorporated into the broader theme of the Quisling-run kingdom's own difficulties with the Nazis. The family that adopts this new "boy" has plenty of problems of it's own and so there are plenty of sub-plots to complement the principal story. The pretty much entirely Nordic cast are all fairly competent, if not exactly outstanding; and it does offer a different take on the usual approach to this subject. IMDb data; ttnr: 3160336, Title: The Birdcatcher, --- Description: The Birdcatcher: Directed by Ross Clarke. With Sarah-Sofie Boussnina, Arthur Hakalahti, Jakob Cedergren, Laura Birn. A Jewish girl Esther is forced to conceal her identity as a boy on a Nazi-Norwegian farm. Plotting her escape to Sweden, her daily challenge to keep her true identity a secret, leads to a series of choices and consequences." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3160336/","name":"The Birdcatcher","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmE5MWUyODQtMjMyNy00MWVjLTgzMTEtZTU5YzNhYTliMmM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjg1NTU5MTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Jewish girl Esther is forced to conceal her identity as a boy on a Nazi-Norwegian farm. Plotting her escape to Sweden, her daily challenge to keep her true identity a secret, leads to a series of choices and consequences.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3160336/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"CinemaSerf","dateCreated":"2020-04-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Yentl with snow instead of singing...","reviewBody":"An enjoyable, if fairly routine story of a young Jewish girl who manages to escape the clutches of her Nazi captors during WWII. She cuts her hair and dresses/acts as a boy and seeks refuge working on a remote farm. What's new? The difference is, this one is set in the harsher climate of Norway and her predicament is incorporated into the broader theme of the Quisling-run kingdom's own difficulties with the Nazis. The family that adopts this new "boy" has plenty of problems of it's own and so there are plenty of sub-plots to complement the principal story. The pretty much entirely Nordic cast are all fairly competent, if not exactly outstanding; and it does offer a different take on the usual approach to this subject. The cinematography is beautifully bleak at times, and generally contributes much to this watchable war story.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1899,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6,"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Drama","History","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-01-08","keywords":"period,holocaust survivor,jewess,teenage girl,norway","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3621883/","name":"Sarah-Sofie Boussnina","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7416233/","name":"Arthur Hakalahti","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0147767/","name":"Jakob Cedergren"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2245581/","name":"Ross Clarke"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0263264/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014956/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3193567/","name":"Trond Morten Kristensen"],"duration":"PT1H40M"</script><metacontent="

The plot, solid. the outcome, OK at best. Class Action has its moments, but spends way too much time developing the father-daughter relationship. This is worth a look, but only if on TV."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6969,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
Revenge: Directed by Tony Scott. With Kevin Costner, Anthony Quinn, Madeleine Stowe, Tomas Milian. A retired US Navy pilot comes to Mexico, where he falls in love with the wife of a powerful businessman. The consequences will be cruel and unforeseen." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0100485/","name":"Revenge","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjIyMjc3YWUtY2M0OS00ZGIxLTkxZTItYzAyODkyMWVmZDBlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQzNDI3NzY@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000126/","name":"Kevin Costner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000063/","name":"Anthony Quinn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000656/","name":"Madeleine Stowe"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001716/","name":"Tony Scott"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0064409/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0059451/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0365659/","name":"Jim Harrison"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0279971/","name":"Jeffrey Alan Fiskin"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Revenge","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1805582617","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjE4NTI5OTUtODVhOS00NjAyLWFlNTctZmFlZjg0OTg0ODQ4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjE4NTI5OTUtODVhOS00NjAyLWFlNTctZmFlZjg0OTg0ODQ4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Pictures"},"datePublished":"1990-02-16","description":"A retired US Navy pilot comes to Mexico, where he falls in love with the wife of a powerful businessman. The consequences will be cruel and unforeseen.","keywords":"betrayal,mexico,adulterous wife,extramarital affair,sex in bed","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0100485/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Nazi_Fighter_David"},"dateCreated":"2003-12-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"'Revenge' surpassed by the flavor of desire and love...","reviewBody":"'Revenge' has a recently retired fighter pilot (Kevin Costner) who goes to the coastal city of Puerto Vallarta, to enjoy the hospitality of an old friend he saves once his life on a hunting trip... 

The possessive longtime friend has a wonderful-but-unhappy wife... Mireya (Madeleine Stowe) is an exotic young brunette, with great magnetism, who truly blew Costner's mind... Mireya embarks on a passionate affair, that naturally drives her husband 'Tibby' (Anthony Quinn) out of his mind...

Sexual tension is an integral part of Tony Scott's character's conflict... It rises off like heat emanating from the sand when the two lovers head in a jeep toward a nearby cute cabin... Costner and Stowe are attracted to one another, and naturally, the more they fight the attraction, the more they are thrown together...

Stowe's body comes alive at that brief caress, quickening her pulse, making her breath catch in anticipation... She experiences the heat in the slow slide of Costner's fingers, a passionate demand she couldn't help but respond to...

The plot is really predictable, and there's real high tension in the first part, but multiple stabbings, shootings, and beatings in the second, as the husband enters a storm of insane fury against the lovers...

'Revenge' is certainly a realm of brutality and pain, of love gone wrong and vengeance gone mad...","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":17192,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"duration":"PT2H4M"}</script><metacontent="
